titleStmt.title: Tvvo petitions from the city of London one to the army, the other to the House of Lords. Concerning the late Lord Mayor, Sir John Geyre, Alderman Bunce, and others, who were ingaged in the bloody murther at Guild-Hall. With the representation of the officers of the army, (of their resolution) to the Parliament, therein. October 12. 1647. These petitions of the city of London, with the resolutions of the army, are appointed to be printed and published by the authority of the licenser, appointed by the House of Peeres, according to an ordinance of both Houses of Parliament. Imprimatur, G.M.
titleStmt.author: City of London (England).

publicationStmt.publisher: by Robert Ibbitson, in Smithfield, neer the Queenes-head Tavern,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: "both abominably false".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
